content.name: Curated demos for Q1
content.old_description: use the left wrist to show commands, look behind and press nextDemo()
content.alt: You have a sphere on your left wrist, touch it to view code snippets
content.description:
You have a sphere on your left wrist.
 You can tap it to reveal snippets of code with your pointing finger.
 Touching these on the left side allows you to:
 - Move them with your right hand
 - Execute with your left hand

To go to the next step in the demo, look behind you and tap 'jxr demoNext()' (edited)

content.name: Physical Table in VR (alignment)
content.description: move the yellow table from center and release it by your desk height

content.name: Tap wrist as shortcut
content.description: left wrist to show hide/code snippets

content.name: Shortcut binding
content.description:
drag and drop onto wrist to make new command
try with nextDemo() then tap it to move on

content.name: Highlight Text
content.description:
Puck a line from a PDF to change its coloor.
The result becomes available in 2D for yourself and others.

Use the highlighters to freely draw over the document, under its text.

See https://companion.benetou.fr/highlights_example.html

content.name: References cards
content.description:
Load a bibliography and manipulate reference as cards.
See https://companion.benetou.fr/references_manual_v04.json

content.name: Manuscript stick to closest panels
content.description:
Use the right wrist to show commands, show panels,
pick then release the manuscript from its center to drop it on the closest panel.

content.name: Unfolding Cube
content.description:
Unfold and fold the cube, scale it to room scale
then back to the size of your hand to mive.

content.name: Screenshot in VR
content.description:
Document your process by taking screenshots
that become instantly available on the Web for yourself
and to collaborators.
See https://companion.benetou.fr/audio_notes_example.html

content.name: Audio recording
content.description:
Document the screenshots by talking over them.
They also become available to share.

Transcriptions are used to make the documentation searchable.
See https://companion.benetou.fr/audio_notes_example.html
